data: PED Newborn Respiratory Illness Exposure (Postpartum / Mother Baby Care) (Module)
Patient Care
Patient Isolation
Droplet and Contact
If newborn is separated from mother, a healthy, asymptomatic partner, family member or designated caregiver may stay with the newborn
Vital Signs
For postpartum newborn admissions: q1h for 3 hours, then at hour 6, then q4h for 24 hours and then routine (as per PSBC Pathway)
For Mother Baby Care / NICU, follow vital signs protocol as per policy
Communication Order
Observe for signs and symptoms of influenza: temperature instability, tachypnea, poor feeding, lethargy, vomiting, diarrhea. Notify physician if change in newborn status
Diet/Nutrition
Communication Order
Review feeding plan with birth parent(s)/family
Communication Order
Nurse to educate anyone interacting with patient to do thorough handwashing. Anyone who is symptomatic and providing care to newborn needs to wear a surgical mask
Laboratory
For Extended Respiratory NAT Panel, select nasopharyngeal flocked swab or nasopharyngeal washing
Extended Respiratory NAT Panel CWH
Nasopharyngeal Flocked Swab, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Extended Respiratory NAT Panel CWH
Nasopharyngeal washings, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Extended Respiratory NAT Panel PHC
Nasopharyngeal Flocked Swab, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Extended Respiratory NAT Panel PHC
Nasopharyngeal washings, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Influenza A/B and RSV NAT
Nasopharyngeal Flocked Swab, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Nasopharyngeal washings, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
